Name Rascal/Libraries/Vis/Figure/Figures/graph

Function Figure graph(Figures nodes, list[Edge] edges, FProperty props...)
Description Takes a list of nodes and a list of edges and draws a graph. The nodes can be arbitrary figures that should have a name (using the id property). The edges determine connections between named nodes.

The following constraints apply:
  • All nodes should have an id property with a unique value.
  • All edges should refer to ids that are defined by the nodes.
Examples 
nodes = [
  box(text("A"), id("A"), size(20), fillColor("LightGreen")),
  box(text("B"), id("B"),  size(30), fillColor("LightCoral")),
  ellipse(text("C"), id("C"),  size(20), fillColor("LightBlue")),
  ellipse(text("D"), id("D"), size(20, 40), fillColor("Fuchsia"))
];
edges = [ 
  edge("A", "B"),
  edge("A", "C"),
  edge("B", "C"),
  edge("C", "D"),
  edge("D", "A")
];    
render(graph(nodes, edges, std(gap(10)), size(50)));


A fully connected graph of n nodes (using spring layout): 
public Figure K(int n){
    nodes = [box(text("<i>"), id("<i>"), size(20), fillColor("LightBlue")) | int i <- [1 .. n] ];
    edges = [[edge("<i>", "<j>") | int j <- [ 1 .. n], j != i] | int i <- [ 1 .. n ] ];
    return graph(nodes, edges, hint("spring"), size(300));
}
render(K(20));


A tree drawn using graph layout: //nodes = [ // box(text("A"), id("A"), size(20), fillColor("green")), // box(text("B"), id("B"), size(20), fillColor("red")), // box(text("C"), id("C"), size(20), fillColor("blue")), // box(text("D"), id("D"), size(20), fillColor("purple")), // box(text("E"), id("E"), size(20), fillColor("lightblue")), // box(text("F"), id("F"), size(20), fillColor("orange")), // box(text("G"), id("G"), size(20), fillColor("brown")) //]; //edges = [ // edge("A", "B"), edge("A", "C"), // edge("B", "D"), edge("B", "E"), //// edge("C", "F"), edge("C", "G") //]; //render(graph(nodes, edges, size(300)));
